title: Revival of SAARC spirit can solve many regional problems: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Yunus
content: Muhammad Yunus, head of Bangladesh's interim government, advocates for reviving SAARC to tackle regional issues. He intends to meet Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the UN General Assembly and aims to gather SAARC leaders for a photo op. Yunus also seeks India's help in addressing the Rohingya crisis impacting Bangladesh.
summary: Muhammad Yunus, head of Bangladesh's interim government, advocates for reviving SAARC to tackle regional issues. He intends to meet Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the UN General Assembly and aims to gather SAARC leaders for a photo op. Yunus also seeks India's help in addressing the Rohingya crisis impacting Bangladesh.

title: 'Psychopath' sets girlfriend's parents' home on fire after dispute in New Jersey
content: In South Brunswick, Leonard Jones, 50, allegedly set fire to his girlfriend's parents' home after an argument. The incident took place around 3 a.m., prompting police response. All four residents managed to escape safely as the fire engulfed the house. Jones was subsequently arrested and charged with aggravated arson and domestic violence.
summary: In South Brunswick, Leonard Jones, 50, allegedly set fire to his girlfriend's parents' home after an argument. The incident took place around 3 a.m., prompting police response. All four residents managed to escape safely as the fire engulfed the house. Jones was subsequently arrested and charged with aggravated arson and domestic violence.

title: Zelenskyy meets top military leaders in Germany as the US announces additional aid to Ukraine
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with U.S. military leaders and over 50 partner nations in Germany to push for more weapons support. The U.S. announced an additional $250 million in security aid for Ukraine. Discussions focused on air defense, artillery supplies, and enhancing Ukraine's defense industrial base as Zelenskyy seeks long-range strike capabilities.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with U.S. military leaders and over 50 partner nations in Germany to push for more weapons support. The U.S. announced an additional $250 million in security aid for Ukraine. Discussions focused on air defense, artillery supplies, and enhancing Ukraine's defense industrial base as Zelenskyy seeks long-range strike capabilities.

title: 'School shooting.. I'm scared': Parents and students share heart-wrenching messages during Apalachee high attack in Georgia
content: A tragic shooting occurred at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, killing four people and injuring nine others. Students sent desperate texts to their parents during the lockdown. The alleged shooter is a 14-year-old student who now faces multiple charges. Victims include two teachers and two students.
summary: A tragic shooting occurred at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, killing four people and injuring nine others. Students sent desperate texts to their parents during the lockdown. The alleged shooter is a 14-year-old student who now faces multiple charges. Victims include two teachers and two students.

title: 'Wanted to play like other children': Roller-skater Gaza girl’s life cut short in Israeli airstrike
content: Hussam Salah Abu Ajwa let his daughter Tala play outside in Gaza City, but an explosion killed her moments later. The conflict has ravaged the area, damaging schools and displacing families. UNRWA cautions that ongoing violence may result in a generation marked by resentment and extremism due to the prolonged conflict.
summary: Hussam Salah Abu Ajwa let his daughter Tala play outside in Gaza City, but an explosion killed her moments later. The conflict has ravaged the area, damaging schools and displacing families. UNRWA cautions that ongoing violence may result in a generation marked by resentment and extremism due to the prolonged conflict.

title: Shinjiro Koizumi announces plan for early election if elected as Japan's new leader
content: Shinjiro Koizumi, former environment minister and top contender for Japan's prime ministerial post, announced plans to call an early election if victorious in the upcoming ruling party leadership race. He intends to maintain existing economic policies while bolstering economic strength. The LDP election on September 27 will decide the next prime minister.
summary: Shinjiro Koizumi, former environment minister and top contender for Japan's prime ministerial post, announced plans to call an early election if victorious in the upcoming ruling party leadership race. He intends to maintain existing economic policies while bolstering economic strength. The LDP election on September 27 will decide the next prime minister.

title: Barron Trump: Donald's 'secret weapon' in fight for Gen Z votes in US presidential elections
content: Donald Trump is using his son Barron to attract Gen Z voters for the upcoming 2024 election. Barron's role includes engaging with digital platforms and influencers, enhancing Trump's connection with younger audiences. According to a SurveyUSA poll, Trump holds a lead over Kamala Harris among voters aged 18-34.
summary: Donald Trump is using his son Barron to attract Gen Z voters for the upcoming 2024 election. Barron's role includes engaging with digital platforms and influencers, enhancing Trump's connection with younger audiences. According to a SurveyUSA poll, Trump holds a lead over Kamala Harris among voters aged 18-34.

title: Tesla driver arrested after being found asleep on autopilot with $100K in illegal drugs
content: Michael Goodman was arrested in Wilson’s Mills, North Carolina, for being asleep behind the wheel of his Tesla on Autopilot. Authorities found over $100,000 worth of illegal drugs in the vehicle. He faces multiple felony charges such as drug trafficking and reckless driving.
summary: Michael Goodman was arrested in Wilson’s Mills, North Carolina, for being asleep behind the wheel of his Tesla on Autopilot. Authorities found over $100,000 worth of illegal drugs in the vehicle. He faces multiple felony charges such as drug trafficking and reckless driving.

title: 'I've got your backs,' Taiwan president tells sailors on combat-ready warship
content: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te visited a combat-ready warship at the Penghu islands base in the Taiwan Strait, expressing support for sailors amid heightened tensions with Beijing. He emphasized unity within the navy and committed to improving military capabilities, highlighting their role in safeguarding Taiwanese security.
summary: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te visited a combat-ready warship at the Penghu islands base in the Taiwan Strait, expressing support for sailors amid heightened tensions with Beijing. He emphasized unity within the navy and committed to improving military capabilities, highlighting their role in safeguarding Taiwanese security.

title: China on alert for super typhoon Yagi: All you need to know about the world's second-strongest storm of 2024
content: China is gearing up for Super Typhoon Yagi's landfall on Friday afternoon, impacting Guangdong and Hainan with strong winds, heavy rains, and coastal flooding. Over 410,000 residents have been evacuated. Shenzhen and Hainan officials caution about potential catastrophic damage, advocating for large-scale evacuations and emergency measures as transport services are suspended.
summary: China is gearing up for Super Typhoon Yagi's landfall on Friday afternoon, impacting Guangdong and Hainan with strong winds, heavy rains, and coastal flooding. Over 410,000 residents have been evacuated. Shenzhen and Hainan officials caution about potential catastrophic damage, advocating for large-scale evacuations and emergency measures as transport services are suspended.

title: 'Impartial force' must be deployed to Sudan: UN experts
content: UN experts have urged for an independent force to protect millions of civilians displaced by Sudan's ongoing conflict between the national army and paramilitary forces. A fact-finding mission uncovered severe rights violations, including airstrikes on civilian targets and sexual violence, which may amount to war crimes. Immediate action is needed to safeguard affected populations.
summary: UN experts have urged for an independent force to protect millions of civilians displaced by Sudan's ongoing conflict between the national army and paramilitary forces. A fact-finding mission uncovered severe rights violations, including airstrikes on civilian targets and sexual violence, which may amount to war crimes. Immediate action is needed to safeguard affected populations.

title: NDP leader Jagmeet Singh ends liberal deal, cites major wins for Canadians: 'We accomplished a lot'
content: NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh announced the termination of the supply-and-confidence agreement with the Liberal government, citing significant achievements such as dental care and progress on national pharmacare. Singh criticized Prime Minister Trudeau for being overly influenced by corporate interests. An election appears more likely, with NDP decisions to be made on a vote-by-vote basis.
summary: NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh announced the termination of the supply-and-confidence agreement with the Liberal government, citing significant achievements such as dental care and progress on national pharmacare. Singh criticized Prime Minister Trudeau for being overly influenced by corporate interests. An election appears more likely, with NDP decisions to be made on a vote-by-vote basis.

title: Pavel Durov’s first statement after arrest in France: 'Telegram is not perfect ... '
content: Telegram co-founder Pavel Durov, after being arrested in France, defended his platform against allegations of enabling criminal activity. He admitted Telegram's imperfections but stressed ongoing efforts to remove harmful content and enhance systems. Criticizing French authorities for personal accountability, he assured users of upcoming improvements to tackle misuse effectively.
summary: Telegram co-founder Pavel Durov, after being arrested in France, defended his platform against allegations of enabling criminal activity. He admitted Telegram's imperfections but stressed ongoing efforts to remove harmful content and enhance systems. Criticizing French authorities for personal accountability, he assured users of upcoming improvements to tackle misuse effectively.

title: After 93 days Nasa's troubled Starliner setting stage for unpiloted return to Earth
content: Boeing's Starliner capsule is set to undock from the International Space Station on September 6, landing in New Mexico six hours later. Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams will remain on the ISS until February, returning aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon ferry ship. The mission encountered helium leaks and thruster issues but aims for a successful landing.
summary: Boeing's Starliner capsule is set to undock from the International Space Station on September 6, landing in New Mexico six hours later. Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams will remain on the ISS until February, returning aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon ferry ship. The mission encountered helium leaks and thruster issues but aims for a successful landing.

title: Vance: 'John McCain wouldn’t stand with Harris on border crisis', Trump's running mate responds to late senator's son endorsing Kamala
content: JD Vance, Republican vice presidential nominee, claimed that the late Sen. John McCain would not support Vice President Kamala Harris if he were alive to witness the current southern border situation. His remarks came after McCain's son endorsed Harris and registered as a Democrat. Vance stressed prioritizing voter opinions over family endorsements.
summary: JD Vance, Republican vice presidential nominee, claimed that the late Sen. John McCain would not support Vice President Kamala Harris if he were alive to witness the current southern border situation. His remarks came after McCain's son endorsed Harris and registered as a Democrat. Vance stressed prioritizing voter opinions over family endorsements.

title: Who was Rich Homie Quan? Rap star found foaming at mouth, pronounced dead at 34: What happened?
content: Atlanta rapper Rich Homie Quan, born Dequantes Devontay Lamar, was found dead at 34. The cause of death is yet to be determined, with an autopsy scheduled. Known for hits like 'Type of Way' and 'Flex,' his passing has left fans and the music industry in shock.
summary: Atlanta rapper Rich Homie Quan, born Dequantes Devontay Lamar, was found dead at 34. The cause of death is yet to be determined, with an autopsy scheduled. Known for hits like 'Type of Way' and 'Flex,' his passing has left fans and the music industry in shock.

title: TikTok's deadly 'chroming' challenge trend: Growing crisis among Gen Z and Gen Alpha
content: A new TikTok trend called 'chroming,' which involves inhaling toxic fumes from aerosol cans for a temporary high, has resulted in several teen deaths. Despite TikTok's efforts to remove harmful content, the trend continues. Families and authorities are urging stricter social media regulations and greater parental vigilance.
summary: A new TikTok trend called 'chroming,' which involves inhaling toxic fumes from aerosol cans for a temporary high, has resulted in several teen deaths. Despite TikTok's efforts to remove harmful content, the trend continues. Families and authorities are urging stricter social media regulations and greater parental vigilance.

title: Who is Allan Lichtman, the 'Nostradamus of US presidential poll predictions'
content: Historian Allan Lichtman, famous for his precise presidential election forecasts, employs a model named 'Keys to the White House.' He predicts Kamala Harris will win against Donald Trump in the 2024 election based on an analysis of 13 political factors. Lichtman's method emphasizes historical patterns over polling data or campaign tactics.
summary: Historian Allan Lichtman, famous for his precise presidential election forecasts, employs a model named 'Keys to the White House.' He predicts Kamala Harris will win against Donald Trump in the 2024 election based on an analysis of 13 political factors. Lichtman's method emphasizes historical patterns over polling data or campaign tactics.

title: Father of Georgia school shooting suspect arrested on charges including second-degree murder
content: A Georgia father has been arrested after his 14-year-old son allegedly fatally shot four people at a high school. The father faces charges including second-degree murder and involuntary manslaughter for allowing his son to possess a weapon. This case highlights the trend of holding parents accountable in school shootings.
summary: A Georgia father has been arrested after his 14-year-old son allegedly fatally shot four people at a high school. The father faces charges including second-degree murder and involuntary manslaughter for allowing his son to possess a weapon. This case highlights the trend of holding parents accountable in school shootings.

title: Pope heads to Papua New Guinea after final Mass in Indonesia before an overflow crowd of 100,000
content: Pope Francis concluded his Indonesian visit with a Mass attended by 100,000 people, urging them to build peace and hope. He is now traveling to Papua New Guinea to meet Catholic missionaries and address social justice issues. In Indonesia, he focused on fostering interfaith dialogue with the Muslim community.
summary: Pope Francis concluded his Indonesian visit with a Mass attended by 100,000 people, urging them to build peace and hope. He is now traveling to Papua New Guinea to meet Catholic missionaries and address social justice issues. In Indonesia, he focused on fostering interfaith dialogue with the Muslim community.
